name: Hotel Teatro

reviews.text: Just got back from a three nite stay at Hotel Teatro. Hotel was wonderful, location is great for walking to both Lamier Square & the 16th Street Mall. It is right next door to the Denver Performing Arts Center. Staff very attentive to all requests, as they should be at a small luxury boutique hotel. Had a standard room with a queen bed. Bed was very comfortable, bathroom nice with separate shower and tub. Only drawback is that when there are performances at the Arts Center, it can be noisy when they let out. I'm from NYC so it didn't bother me, but my sister who is from Spokane was bothered the first nite by the noise. I recommend trying to get a room on a higher floor to muffle the noise. Otherwise, it is a great place and highly recommended.
reviews.title: Three N ghts at the Hotel Teatro

reviews.text: Booked this at the last minute for a cross-country flight from the West Coast. We had tickets for the opera and were booked at the Hyatt. Tripadvisor warnings about that hotel not having valet parking available made me switch as we were going to be arriving after midnight.
reviews.title: Close to the Opera
Fabulous Hotel!
reviews.text: The hotel is beautiful. We had a junior king suite which is actually comprised of two rooms. (I am guessing a "petite room" and a "king room".) We had NO view and looked out over air-conditioning units. If you were there for an extended stay ask for the other side (we were in Room 500).

reviews.title: Fantastic treatment!
reviews.text: We had two full bathrooms which were elegant and equipped. We loved the waterfall shower head and separate hand-held. They have made use of every square inch in this property. The desks in both rooms were set up for business. In the room with the king bed there was a full-size printer and fax.Internet was an upcharge.

reviews.title: World Class Service
reviews.text: We ate at the little cafe on-site after the opera and the food was amazing. For chi chi prices the portions were ample and the quality superb.

I've just enjoyed my third stay at the Hotel Teatro in four months. I've found it to be a top notch boutique hotel with terrific personal & friendly service. While I have not taken advantage of the bar/restaurants on site, I can say that the rooms are clean, modern and very comfortable. I've appreciated the high ceilings and I've always had a great view. I've also takent advantage of the local shuttle service operated by the bellmen - which is very convenient. Although my collegues stay at a smattering of other hotels while in Denver, the Teatro is definitely the one I'll call home.
reviews.title: Excellent Boutique Hotel

reviews.text: One final note, always book this hotel (and others) through the hotel itself and not through a reseller (like orbitz.com). The hotel will often meet or beat the rate offered by the reseller and is much more flexable with the their terms should any arise.
reviews.title: Not worth it

reviews.text: I was attending a medical conference in Nov and chose to stay at the Hotel Teatro as opposed to one of the large convention center type hotels. I generally appreciate the boutique style attention to detail and personal service. Unfortunately I did not find this at the Hotel Teatro. Upon being given a tiny room at the end of the hall with views of a brick wall and noise and cigarette smoke drafting up to my window from the kitchen below, I asked if I might be swithced to another room (I was staying 4 days, which I thought warrented some consideration). I was curtly told by the manager that since I booked mt travel with Orbitz and was "given a very inexpensive rate", he was unable to accomodate my request. I not only found that attitute distasteful but also highly unprofessional. Further, the room I was given apparently had not been used for some time, as the shower/ bath water ran brown when turned on, and there was air in the pipes, causing a spray of toilet water upon flushing and a similar experience with the sink. Not what one would expect in a "Best of Denver" hotel. The only further attempt I made to engage the staff was to inquire about a restaurant I'd read about, and I was "brushed off" by the concierge who seemed more interested in looking at pictures of his car on the internet. This was not a friendly, warm or accomodating hotel in my experience, and if I return to Denver I will be staying at the Hyatt or the Marriott.
reviews.title: A cut above the rest

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2006, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment we arrived to the moment we left, this was a special stay. We were here to celebrate a 50th birthday and as the last stop on our 2-week motorcycle tour of the Rockies we wanted something that bit special, and that is what we got. Our tour organiser, H-CTravel, told us it was good, and they weren't wrong. The room service was faultless, the rooms every bit as good as we hoped, the service at the door, from parking the motorcycles to arranging the complimentary limo, was superb and the local restaurant recommendations excellent. And I have never seen public restrooms in the same class as those under the bar here!
reviews.title: Hotel Teatro the Best Hotel in Denver

likes.liked: — The comfort of the rooms and the friendly staff

reviews.text: We travel all over the world and finally we have found a true luxury hotel. The rooms are spacious and are beautifully decorated. The personal touches are fantastic; they will even send a staff member to draw a bath for you! This is a wonderful hotel with a fantastic location (the Denver Center for Performing is right across the street)! We highly recommend Hotel Teatro. We can’t wait to return.
reviews.title: Nice boutique hotel in Downtown Denver
Teatro: First Class All The Way
reviews.text: I chose this hotel based on the Tripadvisor reviews, and was not disappointed. I booked a "deluxe" room for $175 by calling the hotel (down from their 'regular' $300 per night rate, but the same as the rate on Expedia). The Valet was polite, professional, and helpful, and they provide a car service to take you to restaurants or bars nearby. I took advantage of this and was quickly whisked away to dinner a few blocks away, and promptly picked up when I called to go back to the hotel.

reviews.title: Service beyond Expectation
reviews.text: I recently stayed at the Hotel Teatro while visiting Denver. Shortly after checking in the concierge called our room inquiring if we needed anything (reservations, recommendations, car service, etc.) The valet staff was courteous and prompt. And did I mention the room? Beautifully appointed with a spectacular view of the foothills. If you are looking for a home away from home, Hotel Teatro is the spot.

reviews.title: Best Hotel Ever!!
reviews.text: This hotel deserves two enthusiastic thumbs up!! I stayed there during a convention my company had in Denver and loved every minute of it. From the staff to the amenities I truly felt welcome and valued as a guest. One of the most delightful hotel stays of my life. Bravo Teatro!!!

The Teatro has elegant rooms and a first class staff.(An example being the valets who offered to take our car to a wash and detail center a few miles away when we simply asked about the closest carwash.) The hotel rooms are tiled in marble and the comforters are down.(Worth the upgrade to a superior room). While the location is a short walk from 16th Street mall - I think it is much nicer to be located at the Teatro which is only a few steps from the theatre district and Lamier street! This hotel deserves between 4 and 5 stars.The restaurants located within are critically acclaimed but I feel possibly overhyped. Definately consider having breakfast off property if you are looking for more than continental dining. Overall, our favorite romantic escape.
reviews.title: Boutique Hotel in middle of busy city
Tragicomedic Two-Star
reviews.text: That this hotel considers itself on par with the Oberoi is one of the most pathetic delusions you will ever encounter outside of a mental institution. I admit I was fooled by the great reviews. I arrived to find the carpet and accoutrements shopworn and seedy, the valets unkempt and disinclined to help with baggage. Nevertheless, I pressed on, looking forward to the special evening I'd booked and flown three hours for. But lo! Despite my having booked a month in advance and having been confirmed for a special evening theatre package, I arrived to find that despite my confirmation, the room and package I had booked for a special evening present was not available. The receptionist insisted I'd booked the wrong date, despite the confirmation! She grudgingly stuck us in a room so small we had to crawl over a chair to get to the bed. Moreover, it was between two elevators, so we spent a romantic evening listening to the bells and hall noise all night. Being a stranger to Denver, and by then very disheartened, I did not move to the Brown or even the Westin as I immediately should have. There was no attempt to "make it right" and the special evening I'd planned was a nightmare. Underline, italicize, boldface that statement. I retain the impression that this is business as usual for them, and that the happy reviews below are provided either by relatives of the staff or equally unhappy visitors sharing a hefty dose of schadenfreude aiming to share the misery.

reviews.title: very disappointing stay
reviews.text: We arrived at the Teatro full of expectation, having read reviews etc; we had booked their advertised "theatre package" for what was to be a special night. Upon arrival we found that our reservation had been entered by the staff for the wrong night. We later checked our confirmation letter and found that we had booked the correct night, the hotel had got it wrong. There was basically no apology from the staff, they simply acted as though it was our fault and that we had made the incorrect reservation; there was no effort on the part of the hotel to actually check the reservation we had made other than by looking into their now obviously incorrect reservation system. The hotel could not give us the room we had booked so they put us in a lower class room "a lovely room on the seventh floor with a mountain view" was they way the staff described it. The room was actually the smallest hotel room I have EVER stayed in, it had a view only of the multi story car park/building next door and we were kept awake through the night by the air conditioning/heating systems on that building, movement of the elevator and door opening and closing (we were right in between the two hotel elevators), the trains that run continually through the night and frequent noise by staff and other guests.

description: Upscale, highly regarded business and leisure hotel in downtown Denver, centrally located within two blocks of the Colorado Convention Center, financial district, Denver Center for the Performing Arts, Larimer Square shopping and dining district, as well as the LoDo entertainment district. We pride ourselves on offering the personalized service that keeps our guests coming back. Ideal for business travel, a weekend downtown, romantic getaway, or celebrating any special event, Hotel Teatro is happy to be your "home away from home!"
